chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
m: X -> X -> X
u: X
Hmonoid: monoid_theory m u
k: nat
n: nat
f: nat -> nat -> X

Goal:
(forall i1 j1 i2 j2 : nat, i1 < n -> j1 < k -> i2 < n -> j2 < k -> f i1 j1 ⊕ f i2 j2 = f i2 j2 ⊕ f i1 j1) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => ∑ k (f i)) = ∑ k (fun j : nat => ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i j))

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
monoid_theory : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> X) -> X -> Prop
msum_sum : forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f j ⊕ g i = g i ⊕ f j) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i ⊕ g i) = ∑ n f ⊕ ∑ n g
msum_plus : forall (a b : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ (a + b) f = ∑ a f ⊕ ∑ b (fun i : nat => f (a + i))
msum_comm : forall (a : X) (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i ⊕ a = a ⊕ f i) -> ∑ n f ⊕ a = a ⊕ ∑ n f
msum_only_one : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) (i : nat), i < n -> (forall j : nat, j < n -> i <> j -> f j = u) -> ∑ n f = f i
msum_of_unit : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = u) -> ∑ n f = u
msum_ext : forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = g i) -> ∑ n f = ∑ n g
msum_S : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ (S n) f = f 0 ⊕ ∑ n (fun n0 : nat => f (S n0))
Fin.of_nat_ext : forall h h' : ?p < ?n, Fin.of_nat_lt h = Fin.of_nat_lt h' where ?p : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat k : nat f : nat -> nat -> X |- nat] ?n : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat k : nat f : nat -> nat -> X |- nat]
msum_plus1 : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ (S n) f = ∑ n f ⊕ f n
msum = fix msum (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) {struct n} : X := match n with | 0 => u | S n0 => f 0 ⊕ msum n0 (fun n1 : nat => f (S n1)) end : nat -> (nat -> X) -> X Arguments msum _%nat_scope _%function_scope
Fin.of_nat_to_nat_inv : forall p : Fin.t ?m, Fin.of_nat_lt (proj2_sig (Fin.to_nat p)) = p where ?m : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat k : nat f : nat -> nat -> X |- nat]
msum_0 : forall f : nat -> X, ∑ 0 f = u
msum_1 : forall f : nat -> X, ∑ 1 f = f 0
msum_fold_map : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ n f = fold_right m u (map f (list_an 0 n))
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
list_max_lt : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), l <> nil -> list_max l < n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k < n) l
gcd.is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides p r /\ gcd.divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides p k -> gcd.divides q k -> gcd.divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
gcd.divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.divides (_ _)%nat_scope
f_equal2_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> nat -> B) (x1 y1 x2 y2 : nat), x1 = y1 -> x2 = y2 -> f x1 x2 = f y1 y2
msum_unit : forall n : nat, ∑ n (fun _ : nat => u) = u
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lt_exists_pred : forall z n : nat, z < n -> exists k : nat, n = S k /\ z <= k
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker = fun (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) => Tauto.tauto_checker ZMicromega.Zunsat ZMicromega.Zdeduce ZMicromega.normalise ZMicromega.negate (fun cl : list (RingMicromega.NFormula Z * unit) => ZMicromega.ZChecker (map fst cl)) f w : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z) -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker _ _%list_scope
gcd.is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> gcd.is_gcd p q g -> gcd.is_lcm p q l -> gcd.is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
monoid_unit_l : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m u x = x
monoid_unit_r : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m x u = x
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
